Description: **Cloudflare zones** are assessed for **Always Use HTTPS** setting by checking if it is enabled to automatically redirect all **HTTP requests to HTTPS**, enforcing encrypted transport for all visitors.
Risk:
Without **automatic HTTPS redirects**, users may access resources over unencrypted HTTP.
- **Confidentiality**: traffic can be intercepted and read by attackers on the network path
- **Integrity**: HTTP responses can be modified in transit (content injection, malware insertion)
- **Authentication**: session cookies and credentials may be transmitted in plaintext

Code.Other:
1. Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard and select your account and domain
2. Go to SSL/TLS > Edge Certificates
3. Scroll to Always Use HTTPS
4. Toggle the setting to On
5. Verify that your site works correctly over HTTPS
Code.Terraform:
```hcl
# Enable Always Use HTTPS to redirect HTTP to HTTPS
resource "cloudflare_zone_setting" "always_use_https" {
  zone_id    = "<ZONE_ID>"
  setting_id = "always_use_https"
  value      = "on" # Critical: forces all traffic to use encrypted HTTPS
}
```

Recommendation.Text:
Enable **Always Use HTTPS** to enforce encrypted connections for all visitors.
- Combine with **HSTS** to prevent SSL stripping attacks
- Ensure all resources (images, scripts, stylesheets) are served over HTTPS
- Test for mixed content warnings before enabling
